pullRequest.body:
We already have the corresponding metric spaces structures in `MetricSpace.Basic`.

This adds `Algebra`, `NormOneClass`, `Normed(Add)CommGroup`, `(Nonunital)Normed(Comm)Ring`, `NormedSpace`, and `NormedAlgebra` instances.

The slightly heavy imports here can be blamed on `Topology.Algebra.SeparationQuotient` importing `LinearAlgebra.Basis.VectorSpace` for the final 50-100 lines of the file. Moving this to a new file would cut the chain, as would generalizing it to work in free modules (continuing from #17560), assuming it actually holds there.

---

> It seems that the large import change only relies on the import of `LinearAlgebra.Basis.VectorSpace` in `Topology.Algebra.SeparationQuotient`, which is used only for that result, so if you want to change things a bit that would be easy to avoid (but I don't really care).

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11245302415/job/31265048484)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11245302415/job/31265048004)

Thanks!
It seems that the large import change only relies on the import of `LinearAlgebra.Basis.VectorSpace` in `Topology.Algebra.SeparationQuotient`, which is used only for that result, so if you want to change things a bit that would be easy to avoid (but I don't really care).

bors d+
Without this import, Lean does not know that normed groups are topological groups.
I'm putting this in this file, since the `MetricSpace (SeparationQuotient _)` instance is defined next to the `MetricSpace (Additive _)` instance, and this is consistent.
I think I would rather put it in `Analysis.Normed.Group.Uniform`, just for the sake of keeping `NormedField` a "cheap" import.
Sounds reasonable, done.

```suggestion
  norm := lift Norm.norm fun _ _ h => h.map continuous_norm' |>.eq
```

Then you no longer need `norm_eq_norm_of_dist_eq_zero` and its variations. From a purely Mathlib standpoint I would suggest removing them (people should use the [Inseparable](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Defs/Filter.html#Inseparable) API), unless you see some pedagogical value in them.
How about adding `Inseparable.norm_eq_norm`? I think that might be handy for discoverability.
Sounds good!
Done
